title: What are some examples of human ethics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Virtue ethics (e.g. Aristotle, Ethics)Consequentialism (e.g. Mill, Utilitarianism)Deontology (e.g. Kant, Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals) These are the most widely supported by professional philosophers. About a quarter “lean toward” or “accept” consequentialism and deontology. About a sixth “lean toward” or “accept” virtue ethics. About a third support “Other”. Other ethical theories include: Theism (as in Moses, Jesus, Muhammed)Contractualism (Rawls, Scanlon)Ethical Egoism (Ayn Rand)Needs theory (Soran Reader)Care theory (Nel Noddings)Triple Theory (Derek Parfit) This is just a short list… one could go on for pages…

Ethics are like the rules of a spirting contest. They are guidelines of conduct that ensure a “level playing field”. For example, it would be unethical for me to conspire to have my opponents food tainted in some way that reduces his/her performance. In like fashion, it would also be unethical to manufacture false allegations of marital infidelity to psychologically or emotionally imbalance my opponent. Ethics vary from situation to situation and have to be adjusted periodically in response to the impact of new tecnologies on human relations. The best system for maintaining an ethical society is to observe a tradition of logical and compassionate education and nurture of succeeding generations.
